title: How to Build and Use a Small Greenhouse out of Transparent Corrugated Sheet

steps.headline: Assemble the supplies needed.
steps.description: Check the "Things You'll Need" list below.

steps.headline: Cut and bend 3 mm iron wire to form 2 bows.
steps.description: Each bow has 5 loops as shown on the photo below. The distance between the two U shaped ends is about 1 cm (3/8 inch) larger than the width of the corrugated sheet used for the tunnel.

steps.headline: Bend 8 iron pens each at about 8 to 10 cm (3 to 4 inches) from the end to form a handle.
Cut 8 pieces of plastic hose, length about 12 cm (5 inch).
steps.description: Cover each handle and a part of the pen with plastic hose.

steps.headline: Cut 4 pieces of plastic hose, length about 12 cm (5 inch).
steps.description: Use a knife or sharp scissors to cut each piece in longitudinal direction.

steps.headline: Use sharp scissors or a fine bladed hand saw to cut one corrugated sheet to size.
steps.description: Two small plates of approx. 45 x 45 cm (18 x 18 inch) are needed. Or cut 4 narrow plates of about 25 x 45 cm (10 x 18 inch).

steps.headline: Bend the corrugated sheet and put 2 bows over it, about 20 to 40 cm (8 to 16 inch) from each end.
Put each of the 4 plastic hoses (with longitudinal cut) between the bow and the edge of the sheet.
steps.description: The hose protects the material of the plate against the wire.

steps.headline: When needed bend the sheet and the iron bows to the desired round or rectangular shape.
Lift the greenhouse at the 2 loops on top of the bows.
steps.description: Then put the greenhouse at the desired place in the garden.

steps.headline: Push 4 pens in the 4 small loops to fix the greenhouse.
At each end push one small plate of corrugated sheet or 2 overlapping plates in the earth against the edge of the greenhouse tunnel.
steps.description: Depth is about 15 cm (6 inch). The "waves" in the sheets form air openings.

steps.headline: Closed position: Close the greenhouse at cold weather.
One side open:  Open the tunnel at the sunny side at warm weather.
steps.description: Shift each iron bow + hose (to and fro) to put the pen's handle in the "bow's eye".

steps.headline: Lifted position: Lift the tunnel at both long sides at cold weather when plants are big.
steps.description: Put all 4 pen's handles in 4 "bow's eyes".

text: Prepare the Materials Assemble the supplies needed. Check the "Things You'll Need" list below. Cut and bend 3 mm iron wire to form 2 bows. Each bow has 5 loops as shown on the photo below. The distance between the two U shaped ends is about 1 cm (3/8 inch) larger than the width of the corrugated sheet used for the tunnel. Bend 8 iron pens each at about 8 to 10 cm (3 to 4 inches) from the end to form a handle. Use a bench vice. Cut 8 pieces of plastic hose, length about 12 cm (5 inch). Cover each handle and a part of the pen with plastic hose. Cut 4 pieces of plastic hose, length about 12 cm (5 inch). Use a knife or sharp scissors to cut each piece in longitudinal direction. Use sharp scissors or a fine bladed hand saw to cut one corrugated sheet to size. Two small plates of approx. 45 x 45 cm (18 x 18 inch) are needed. Or cut 4 narrow plates of about 25 x 45 cm (10 x 18 inch). Build the Greenhouse Bend the corrugated sheet and put 2 bows over it, about 20 to 40 cm (8 to 16 inch) from each end.  Put each of the 4 plastic hoses (with longitudinal cut) between the bow and the edge of the sheet. The hose protects the material of the plate against the wire. When needed bend the sheet and the iron bows to the desired round or rectangular shape.  Place the Greenhouse Lift the greenhouse at the 2 loops on top of the bows. Then put the greenhouse at the desired place in the garden. Push 4 pens in the 4 small loops to fix the greenhouse.  At each end push one small plate of corrugated sheet or 2 overlapping plates in the earth against the edge of the greenhouse tunnel. Depth is about 15 cm (6 inch). The "waves" in the sheets form air openings. Use the Greenhouse Closed position: Close the greenhouse at cold weather.  One side open:  Open the tunnel at the sunny side at warm weather. Shift each iron bow + hose (to and fro) to put the pen's handle in the "bow's eye". Lifted position: Lift the tunnel at both long sides at cold weather when plants are big. Put all 4 pen's handles in 4 "bow's eyes".
